title.narrative: West Africa Competitiveness Programme - Ghana Component

description.narrative: The programme proposes interventions for development and enhanced competitiveness of three product groups with strong regional and global value chains potential for job creation and growth through value chain linkages by connecting industries in Ghana with those of the region which supply input for processing or market for Ghanaian industry. These are Processed Fruits, Cassava and Cosmetics and Personal-Care Products. The selection is in line with the regional industrialization priority setting which accords frontline roles to agro-industry and light manufacturing with emphasis on value-added transformation of local raw materials, increasing the industrial sector#s contribution to GDP, contributing to increasing the share of industrial products in regional trade and increase of industrial products from West Africa to the world market. The Action will engage selected MSMEs involved in the business of the value chains with a view to strengthening their management and capacity to reach higher value levels; promoting acquisition of new technology and innovation; market linkages at local, regional and international levels and strengthening the MSMEs# capacity to fulfill buyer and market access requirements. Relevant business support institutions will be strengthened and resourced to support the value cha ins. The pr
